meanings.definition: A platform projecting from the wall of a building, enclosed by a railing or balustrade, supported by columns or console brackets.
meanings.sent1: The balconies of the old house overlooked the garden below.
meanings.sent2: People gathered on the balconies to watch the parade pass by.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat climbed onto the balcony and refused to come down.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts stood on the balcony of uncertainty, unsure of which path to take.
meanings.sent5: The balconies swayed gently in the breeze, offering a peaceful view of the city skyline.

meanings.sent1: The theater's balconies provided a great view of the stage.
meanings.sent2: The audience filled the balconies, eagerly awaiting the performance.
meanings.sent3: During the play, the actors pretended to interact with the imaginary people in the balconies.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed through the balconies, adding to the joy of the show.
meanings.sent5: The balconies were adorned with elegant drapes, enhancing the theater's grandeur.
